comment: Overall fine, but often very unclear on expectations and instructions. Be prepared to ask lots of questions for clarity, and be prepared to ask again when the answer isn't always helpful the first time. Points for being somewhat flexible with deadlines.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Montalvo is passionate and knowledgeable about ESOL. She shared her personal experiences with us as an ESOL student. I think everything she brings to the course is helpful. She will appreciate if you participate in class discussions. Her questions are a little too broad to answer, but try your best! Overall I enjoyed her class.

Class is very boring, but normally lets out early. She can be an easy grader on some assignments. She has a lot of group work and makes a lot of our assignments in class so if you have questions you can ask or work with groups. She can seem strict but overall I would take her again.

I enjoyed this class and learned a lot. Our class started out struggling with her, but at the mid-semester evaluation, she changed how things were going based on our feedback and it turned into one of my favorite classes. I learned so much valuable information on teaching ELL students. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Nice woman. Class is boring but good time to get other work done. 1 group project, 2 take home exams (1 is the final), weekly discussion & module assignment. She's a super slow grader, but usually grades pretty easy. She teaches us like we're grad students. There's a ton of reading. Easy A- if you don't try very hard you'll probably make a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS
